chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: Soya is a general-purpose, object-oriented, safe programming language. It is designed to be simple, consistent and easy to use, while providing the power and safety to develop both low-level performance-critical systems and high-level applications of any size.

This document describes the syntax and semantics of Soya. Using the information in this document, it should be possible for any interested party to implement programs that process Soya source code, for instance compilers, interpreters or code analyzers.

listitem.para: James Gosling, Bill Joy, Guy Steele, and Gilad Bracha. The Java Language Specification, Third Edition. Prentince Hall, Englewood Cliffs, New Jersey, 2005, ISBN 978-0321246783.
